reviewtext: I've got my Zip 250-USB running on a 1Ghz Pentium 3 with Windows ME and had no trouble getting it installed.  Have not had any system locks, either.  It's much faster than my old Zip 100 that ran on the parallel port, though the 250-USB reads Zip 100 disks with no problem (though slower than 250 disks).  I'm using Iomega's Quik Sync back-up software and it's great to have it operating automatically in the background, without me having to remember to do it.When I bought mine, the USB-powered version was not yet available, so mine uses an AC power adapter.  The USB-powered version would be nice to have for running on my laptop.
